meanings.definition: To commit (an illegal, harmful, or immoral act)
meanings.sent1: The thief perpetrates a crime by stealing from the store.
meanings.sent2: He perpetrates fraud by deceiving people with false promises.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat perpetrates a daring escape from the house.
meanings.sent4: Her words perpetrate a storm of emotions in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The villain perpetrating evil deeds in the dark alley sends shivers down the spine.

meanings.definition: To carry out or perform (an action)
meanings.sent1: She perpetrates her plan to surprise her friend with a birthday party.
meanings.sent2: The chef perpetrates a culinary masterpiece with his secret recipe.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel perpetuates a hilarious acrobatic show in the park.
meanings.sent4: His music perpetuates a sense of calm and tranquility in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist perpetrating a colorful mural on the wall brightens up the entire street.
